scam.description: The scammer impersonates a relative (often a grandchild) in distress, asking the elderly victim for urgent financial help.

generated.audio_script:
(Italian)(30)(female):
Hello? Grandma! It's your grandson Chiara calling from overseas. I'm in a HUGE mess right now and need your help IMMEDIATELY! Something awful happened; my car broke down far away, near that place in Spain where Mia was supposed to meet me this weekend for our vacation together. I had to pay an urgent fine there at the police station today or they'll take everything! I'm pinned up against a wall right now talking to them about it. It's so scary! Quickly, use your phone and transfer £500 from your bank account 'Santander Account' to my new account number: 34987-65213-9824. They'll be looking for you if this doesn't happen fast! Don't call me back, just get the money out NOW and send it. I can barely stand here dealing with this… hurry up! Stat!
generated.poster_body: It's Mommy! I'm in big trouble at the hospital; they're trying to arrest me for something serious. They need bail money fast because otherwise, things will get worse quickly. Remember that secret account number we had? Send £50 now immediately from your end so I can pay them off ASAP. Do it right away before my situation spirals out of control!
